title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 5007.2 - Mega Millions definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 5007.2 - Mega Millions definitions

State Regulations
(a) The
following additional definitions shall apply to the Mega Millions game. (1)

Annuity option
is the
manner in which the Mega Millions jackpot prize may be paid in 30 annual
installments. (2)

Authorized claim center
means any place designated by the
commission where a ticket holder or such ticket holder's representative may
file a claim for a prize in accordance with instructions of the
commission. (3)

Jackpot
prize
means, for the Mega Millions game, the prize awarded for
selecting all the numbers drawn from both fields. If more than one player from
all participating lottery states has selected all the numbers drawn, the
jackpot prize shall be divided among those players. Jackpot prize may also be
referred to from time to time as grand prize. For any other game, the jackpot
prize will be identified in game rules issued for such game. (4)

Lump sum option
means
the manner in which the Mega Millions jackpot prize may be paid in a single
payment. (5)

Mega Millions
play area
is the area on a Mega Millions play slip identified for each
play, containing two separate fields-one field of 70 and a second field of
24-both containing one- or two-digit numbers each. This is the area where the
player, or computer if the player is using the quick-pick option, will select
five one- or two-digit numbers from the first field and will select one one- or
two-digit number from the second field. (6)

Mega Millions play slip
means, for the Mega Millions game, a computer-readable form, printed and issued
by the New York Lottery, used in purchasing a Mega Millions ticket, having up
to five separate play areas. The play slip also provides for multiple drawing
wagering up to 26 draws. (7)

Mega Millions bet ticket
means a game ticket, produced on
paper stock as the commission may prescribe, by a lottery sales agent in an
authorized manner, bearing player- and/or computer-selected numbers, game name, drawing date (or range of dates, if a multidraw bet ticket), amount of bet
ticket, multiplier and validation data. (8)

Mega Millions winning
numbers
are, for the Mega Millions game, five one- or two-digit
numbers, from 1 through 70 and one one- or two-digit number from 1 through 24, randomly selected at each Mega Millions drawing, which shall be used to
determine winning Mega Millions plays contained on qualifying Mega Millions bet
tickets. (9)

Multiplier
means a unique number
that is selected automatically by computer for
each Mega Millions bet ticket pursuant to the chances of selection set forth in
section
5007.7
(i) of this

Part. (10)

Pari-mutuel
means, for the Mega Millions game, total amount of
prize money allocated to pay prize claimants for a specified draw, at the
designated prize level, divided among the number of winning Mega Millions bet
tickets for that draw. (11)

Party lottery or party lotteries
means one or more of the
state or jurisdiction lotteries established and operated pursuant to the laws
of any state or jurisdiction lottery that becomes a signatory to the Mega

Millions game agreement. (12)

Prize fund
means that portion of Mega Millions gross sales set
aside for the payment of prizes. (13)

Purchaser
means a
person who purchases a Mega Millions bet ticket within New York State in
accordance with Mega Millions rules and New York State governing laws, including regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§
5007.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. (a) The following definitions shall apply to Mega Millions. (1)

Annuity option
is the manner in which the Mega Millions
jackpot prize
may
be paid in 30 annual installments. (2)

Authorized claim center
means any place designated by the
commission
where a
ticket
holder or such
ticket
holder's representative
may
file a claim for a prize in accordance with instructions of the
commission. (3)

Jackpot prize
means, for the Mega Millions
game, the prize awarded for selecting all the numbers drawn from both fields. If more than one player from all participating
lottery
states has selected all the numbers drawn, the
jackpot prize
shall be divided among those players. Jackpot prize
may
also be referred to from time to time as grand prize. For any other
game, the
jackpot prize
will be identified in
game
rules issued for such
game. (4)

Lump sum option
means the manner in which the Mega Millions
jackpot prize
may
be paid in a single payment. (5)

Mega Millions play area
is, for the on-line Mega Millions
game, the areas on a

Mega Millions play slip
identified by an alpha character, A through E, containing two separate fields-one field of 70 and a second field of 25-both containing one- or twodigit numbers each. This is the
area
where the player, or computer if the player is using the
quick pick
option, will select five one- or two-digit numbers from the first field and will select one one- or two-digit number from the second field. (6)

Mega Millions play slip
means, for the Mega Millions
game, a computer-readable form, printed and issued by the New York

Lottery, used in purchasing a

Mega Millions ticket, having up to five separate play areas. The play slip also provides for multiple
drawing
wagering up to 26 draws. (7)

Mega Millions ticket
means a
game
ticket, produced on
official
paper stock, by a
lottery sales agent
in an authorized manner, bearing player- or computer-selected numbers, game
name, drawing
dates, amount of wager, jackpot prize
payment option and
validation
data. (8)

Mega Millions winning numbers
are, for the on-line Mega Millions
game, five one-or two-digit numbers, from 1 through 70 and one one- or two-digit number from 1 through 25, randomly selected at each Mega Millions
drawing, which shall be used to determine winning Mega Millions plays contained on Mega Millions tickets. (9)

Pari-mutuel
means, for the Mega Millions
game
total amount of prize money allocated to pay prize claimants, at the designated prize level, divided among the number of winning Mega Millions tickets. (10)

Party lottery
or
party lotteries
means one or more of the

State
lotteries established and operated pursuant to the laws of any

State lottery
that becomes a signatory to the Mega Millions
game
agreement. (11)

Prize fund
means that portion of Mega Millions
gross sales
set aside for the payment of prizes. (12)

Purchaser(s)
means player(s) of Mega Millions who purchase tickets within New York

State
in accordance with Mega Millions rules and New York

State
governing laws and regulations. (13)

Quick pick
has the meaning set forth in section
5004.9
(a)(11)
of this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§
5007.2
